https://stringpotatotheory.github.io/awe.body:
There's a lot of websites with information like "Games like X" but what if you really like a specific mechanic? Either have a look at the Games tab, use the search bar, or view the homepage to start your search!
Feel free to add games to these lists (or make your own video game mechanics lists!) by contributing to the repo on GitHub. Either create an issue with your mechanic and games, or fork and create a pull request with your additions.

If you are looking for general tags for games like RPG, turn-based, single-player, etc., you could try using Steam to search for categories and tags for PC games, or the below:

Steam250
HowLongToBeat

For compatibility with hardware and controllers, platforms the game can run on, single-player and multi-player and so much more, try PCGamingWiki.

Have a look at their list of lists

If you are trying to find a game in your Steam library:

try making a collection in Steam
or import your library here.

For looking at current and historical prices:

SteamDB
IsThereAnyDeal


The theme for this website, Abridge, is licensed under the MIT license.

https://stringpotatotheory.github.io/awe.body:
Prime examples of this are the time rewind mechanics in Life is Strange, and Braid.
Note this is different than the entire game being a time loop.

Life is Strange
Braid

Smaller mechanic in the game

Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom - You can rewind certain objects in the world so they move, but you aren't rewinding yourself or anything else outside of that object.
https://stringpotatotheory.github.io/awe.description: Where the player can rewind time.
